output rect and damage rect so that we no longer include clipped area to

performance.

entry.title: Extensions: Handle Open Settings by User from an Extension Notification
entry.content:
In the case where, on Linux:



1. An extension uses chrome.notifications to create a

notification.

2. The notification appears with a Settings" button.

3. The user clicks on the button.



Chrome will crash, as the ExtensionNotificationHandler does not

override the method OpenSettings, which triggers a NotReached().



The actual settings button comes from here on Linux:

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/notifications/notification_platform_bridge_linux.cc;l=771-774



When the user clicks on the settings button, the Notification Handler,

which is registered here: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/notifications/notification_display_service_impl.cc;l=98-102;



gets triggered over here: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/notifications/notification_display_service_impl.cc;l=175-177



and this is what triggers the NotReached() since

NotificationHandler::OpenSettings() gets called.



Bug: 327334170

Change-Id: I72b08cd5c2f7d0eeb4201540a3d43441c0960f43

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5332512

Reviewed-by: David Bertoni

Commit-Queue: Vikram Pasupathy

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1269987}

entry.title: Files app: Change from Entry to FileData in the new DirectoryTree #4
entry.content:
Simplify the handling of SHORTCUT roots, deferring the handling of

stale entry to the `changeDirectory()` action/reducer.



Fix the clearCachedEntriesReducer() which wasn't clearing entries that

were expanded, even if nothing pointed to such entry.



Minor changes:



Fix some spelling Drives vs Drive.



Remove the word `entry` in the directory_tree_container.ts to make

easier to find entry usage.



Remove `Entry` word from `isEntryInsideDrive()` since it also accepts

FileData.

entry.title: Revert "Add user counters for RGB, OkLabOkLch, and out-of-Rec2020"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 5bbfa8445fac8d5a095faf63c18dbd3f86289864.



Reason for revert: Some parsing tests are failing after this patch,

on Linux dbg

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20Tests%20(dbg)(1)/119105/test-results?sortby=&groupby=





Original change's description:

> Add user counters for RGB, OkLabOkLch, and out-of-Rec2020

>

> Add counters for the CSS Color Level 4 syntax, dividing the syntax

> into the classes of RGB spaces versus OkLab/OkLch (OkLxx). For these

> two classes, track how often they specify a color outside of the

> Rec2020 gamut.

>

> This is to inform choices about how to handle out-of-range values

> in the OkLab/OkLch syntax.

>

> Mark the counters kCSSColorColorSpecifiedSpace, kCSSColorLabOklab,

> and kCSSColorLchOklch obsolete, because they were observed not to be

> used anymore.

>

> Previously landed in crrev.com/1256189

> Reverted in crrev.com/1256383

> Reason for revert fixed in crrev.com/1256784

>

entry.title: Fix incorrect Exception when signing in through sync and blocked signout
entry.content:
When signing in through the enable sync flow (not FRE or any of the

bottom bar flows) we don't set the account management bit before

performing the signin, but this is fine as the user still saw the

account management confirmation and the bit will get set during

signin.



Also, setting the account management bit was unintentionally blocking

signout on Android. This behavior was only intended to be applied on

desktop as Android was not previously using the account management

confirmation bit.



Bug: 40944120

entry.title: lens: Add a close button to the overlay.
entry.content:
This CL makes several small changes:



(1) Fixes some mistakes in the plumbing for the lens overlay WebUI.



(2) Adds a close button to the overlay, adds a close method to the

mojom, and hooks them together.



(3) Creates a mechanism to uniquely tie together the WebUIController and

the LensOverlayController.



(4) Removes LensPageHandler, as LensOverlayController now directly

communicates with the WebUI.

> [UNOp2][Android] Allow showing accounts list when sign-in flow starts

>

> When the user selects "Choose Account" from sign-in promo (e.g. in the

> bookmark manager"), the new sign-in flow should start and show the

> expanded sign-in bottom sheet with an accounts list, instead of the

entry.title: [A11y] Reduce redundant ignored change processing
entry.content:
If the current node is ignored, fire children changed on the

unignored ancestor, otherwise fire it on the current node. Do

not fire an extra children changed event on an unignored node.



In addition, it is not necessary to deal with the case where

there is no unignored ancestor, because the root cannot be ignored.

This is an illegal case and it's better to replace this with the

CHECK and deal with anything providing that as it is a bad input.



The removed unit tests all relate to cases where the illegal case

occurs. It does not seem worth trying to find ways to convert those

tests into something legal, as they were designed around an

incorrect assumption.



Bug: b/327473167

Change-Id: I298b849961ad2124047734c5d8e58773b1d42adb

entry.content:
An incorrect assertion was added in http://crrev.com/c/5113715 that

the first account in the list of fetched accounts always has the

property isDeviceAccount = true. While the first account is always the

device account, sometimes this property is false. The assertion is

removed and a TODO is added to further investigate why the property

does not match.

entry.title: Mitigate background Windows OS networking module loads causing jank.
entry.content:
This fix addresses some jank we've observed in Edge. The change updates

GetMacSsidMapUsingWinrt() to use

SCOPED_MAY_LOAD_LIBRARY_AT_BACKGROUND_PRIORITY_REPEATEDLY() for the OS

WinRT APIs that load modules. Otherwise, the UI thread may become

blocked loading its own modules while waiting for

GetMacSsidMapUsingWinrt() to finish loading modules at background

priority. For more details, see https://crbug.com/973868.



Bug: 1502604

Change-Id: Id27199e9ec4458d7a549d14784c5c16c326b157d

entry.title: Tick keyboard and scripted smooth scrolls on the compositor thread.
entry.content:
After unification, we can update the scroll offset on the compositor

thread, even if the scroller is not composited or otherwise repaints on

main. ScrollableArea::ShouldScrollOnMainThread, which was only used by

the scroll animator classes, is modified and renamed to achieve this for

smooth scrolls that are initiated from main.



WebPagePopup is still a special case that needs to tick on main (see

crbug.com/1503709 and crbug.com/1270173).



Bug: 325081538

entry.title: IDB: Merge IndexedDBConnection and DatabaseImpl into a single class.
entry.content:
DatabaseImpl is a thin wrapper around its IndexedDBConnection member.

This change deletes IndexedDBConnection, moving its functionality into

DatabaseImpl where it can be used directly. This change does not alter

any IndexedDB behavior.



The change also renames DatabaseImpl to IndexedDBConnection.

The moved function, IndexedDBConnection::CreateTransaction(), is merged

with the existing DatabaseImpl::CreateTransaction() inherited from

blink::mojom::IDBDatabase to avoid build errors due to conflicting

return values.



The change updates unit tests to use the newly merged

IndexedDBConnection::CreateTransaction(). Two of the updated tests

need to simulate commit phase two storage corruption errors by creating

a FakeTranscation, which is no longer possible through

IndexedDBConnection::CreateTransaction(). As an alternative, the

change defines a new test helper function,

CreateFakeTransactionWithCommitPhaseTwoError(), which creates

a new transaction and then adds it to IndexedDBConnection using private

members. This enables the use of a fake backing transaction to

simulate errors for testing.



Bug: 41483624

Change-Id: I17439e357cff3b867beb07e62cd21799df12a1cf

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5345854

Reviewed-by: Ayu Ishii

Commit-Queue: Steve Becker

Reviewed-by: Evan Stade

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1269902}

entry.title: WebUI: Don't use Lit's changedProperties for non-costly calculations.
entry.content:
Based on guidance from the Lit team, it should be OK to not use `changedProperties.has(...)` checks for every single computed property

calculation in the willUpdate() lifecycle callback, since Lit is still

smart enough to not touch the DOM when nothing changes.



Adopting this approach overall results in a simpler mental model, with

less reactive properties, where developers don't need to list the

dependencies of a computed property, and can instead rely on Lit doing

the heavy lifting.



Moreover, while our preferred style of using Lit is still being

determined, avoiding intentionally to inline TS expressions within the

Lit template, to better separate TS and HTML and avoid blurring the

boundary more than absolutely necessary.



Bug: 40943652

Change-Id: I60666a2ce225f0cfca72dd7b57c7d822821afe59

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5350701

entry.title: [rebaseline-cl] Explicitly disable manifest updates by workers
entry.content:
Currently, rebaseline tool workers don't set the `manifest_update`

option. In https://crrev.com/c/5232061, the meaning of omitting that

value changed from "not updating" to "maybe updating". This CL restores

the previous behavior because it's never safe to update manifests

concurrently, and the main process should have already updated the

manifests.

entry.title: Revert "Improve AudioRendererMixer sharing across RenderFrames."
entry.content:
This reverts commit a6068ebab3469d9d7793381987b1168434afaabe.



Reason for revert: Causing too many unforeseen consequences, see

327884890, 327489297



Original change's description:

> Improve AudioRendererMixer sharing across RenderFrames.

>

> It's common for a page to have a lot of YouTube embeds. With the

> current code, none of those embeds share a mixer and thus can

> trigger the 50 physical stream limit quickly.

>

> AFAICT, there's no good reason to prevent sharing of these streams

> across render frames when the default device is used. They are

> output only and an uncompromised renderer can't directly observe

> any effects (readback for WebAudio and MediaStreams happens

> asynchronously below the shared output).

>

> Often the default device is already being shared at the OS level,

> so any demultiplexing we do in the renderer seems pointless.

>

> Looking through the history we've always limited the sharing to

> per RenderFrameID, but it was only out of an abundance of caution

> rather than a particular concern.

>

> For non-default devices there's good reasons we shouldn't share:

> permissions are required per-origin to access the non-default

> device.

>

> R=olka, tguilbert

>

> Bug: b/314766691

> Change-Id: I7ee6865eb675962aff2aeedcd7290666b38c91e5

entry.title: [iOS][Waffle] Fix EGTest for search engine dialog
entry.content:
This patch updates `[SettingsAppInterface resetSearchEngine]` to

clear kDefaultSearchProviderChoiceScreenCompletionTimestamp pref.



To make FirstRunWithSearchEngineChoiceTestCase tests more reliable,

`[SettingsAppInterface resetSearchEngine]` is called in the setUp

and the tearDown. This is to make sure those tests won't fail and

to clean up after the tests.



Same principal about setUp and tearDown is applied to

`SearchEngineTestCase`.

Therefore those EGTests can be enabled:

SearchEngineTestCase/testOpenSecondWindow

SearchEngineTestCase/testSearchEngineChoiceScreenSelectThenScroll

SearchEngineTestCase/testSearchEngineChoiceScreenScrollThenSelect

entry.title: Add Android support of feature param to disable crash uploading.
entry.content:
A `disable_crashes` feature parameter was added to the MetricsReportingFeature in the following CL, with support limited to Windows.



* https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4855367



This CL adds support for the same feature parameter to the Android platform. This involves a small refactor to split existing `MetricsAndCrash` methods into separate `Metrics` and `Crashes` methods.



This change allows control of whether a metrics reporting group also sends crash reports. For example, an oversampled group can be configured to send metrics but not crash reports.



Bug: 40272661

Change-Id: I522dc330bc69ca95caf77e7b45fa764e96863d89

Low-Coverage-Reason: TRIVIAL_CHANGE The only change missing coverage is a method rename in ChromeMinidumpUploaderDelegate.java

development of the GTFO OOP-VD feature. It refactors the OOP-VD feature

flag to make it so that client code sees one of 3 OOP-VD modes: regular

OOP-VD (where the GPU process is used as a proxy), GTFO OOP-VD (where

the GPU process is NOT used as a proxy), and no OOP-VD (hw video

decoding is done in the GPU process).

entry.title: [TSLO] Fix incorrect tab strip padding color
entry.content:
The padding layer update logic that currently lives in

UpdateTabStripLeftFade/UpdateTabStripRightFade will not be invoked when

the strip fade is not visible (for example, when the strip is scrolled

to the end, when there are few tabs), resulting in an incorrect padding

layer color due to no update when the tab models are switched, as in the

linked bug.



This CL moves this logic to UpdateTabStripLayer that is guaranteed to be

invoked under all circumstances when the strip is updated.

entry.title: Send the effective DNS-over-HTTPS URI template to Lacros
entry.content:
On Chrome OS, determining the effective DNS-over-HTTPS URI template is

complex.



Chrome OS supports the cross-platform policy kDnsOverHttpsTemplates and

the Chrome OS policy kDnsOverHttpsTemplatesWithIdentifiers. When both

are configured, the latter has priority.



The kDnsOverHttpsTemplatesWithIdentifiers policy allows the admin to

configure placeholders for user and device identifiers, which are

replaced with read user and device data in Chrome.



Instead of syncing all the relevant prefs with Lacros for Lacros to

determine the effective URI template, this CL syncs the

kDnsOverHttpsEffectiveTemplatesChromeOS pref with Lacros.



This change also lays the groundwork for introducing the device IP

addresses to the DnsOverHttpsTemplatesWithIdentifiers policy since

Lacros does not directly monitor default network changes.

See go/ip-for-doh-uri-template.



Bug: b/307735537, b/325415682

Change-Id: I836496eb6b16a1a06c5cd71f27b3625ffb9b0b0f

entry.title: Clear user activation on cross-site navigations.
entry.content:
When full site isolation is disabled, renderer processes and

RenderFrameHosts are re-used when performing cross-site navigations.

This includes user activation state, and, more specifically, the sticky

`has_been_active_` bit in `UserActivationState`.



Currently, the `UserActivationState` on the renderer-side is reset only

if the navigation's associated frame is a main frame. That means that if

an iframe navigates to a cross-site page, its sticky user activation

state will be the leftover state from the previous page. So, if a user

interacted with the previous page in any capacity, the newly loaded page

will think it has received a user gesture, essentially using an

unintentional cache of the user activation state.



This becomes an issue when dealing with our framebusting interventions.

We only allow an iframe to do a top-level navigation if it received a

user gesture. However, if an iframe's previous document received a user

activation, or worse, if the iframe was not navigated to anything and

got a user activation because its embedder was interacted with, this

allows the current document to circumvent our framebusting

interventions. The latter happens because of same-origin descendant

activation behavior. See:

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/browser/renderer_host/frame_tree_node.cc;l=766-778;drc=30753b1135fa271a3b45bbdbfef6567e46733a7f;bpv=1;bpt=1



Note that this problem does not exist if site isolation is enabled

(which is by default on desktop platforms), since a cross-site

navigation will create a whole new process with a fresh

`UserActivationState`.



To fix this, this CL clears the user activation state on cross-site

subframe navigations in the renderer (user activation is already cleared

for main frames). To ensure that same-site navigations persist user

state even if a cross-origin or same-origin navigation results in a new

process or RenderFrameHost being created, this CL also explicitly

transfers sticky user activation state for all same-site

cross-RenderFrameHost navigations. This takes place in the browser, and

the resulting bit to determine if a frame should have sticky user

activation is passed to the renderer.



The ultimate end goal is to unconditionally clear the user activation

state for all cross-document navigations. That unfortunately is not

possible today as there are entrenched use cases that rely on sticky

user activation state being cached for same-site navigations. See:

https://crbug.com/40228985.



This CL also fixes the aforementioned regression when enabling the

RenderDocument feature, since this CL will now preserve the sticky user

activation state regardless of what

process/RenderFrameHost/RenderDocument state the navigation results in.



This CL adds some tests to the no-auto-wpt-origin-isolation test suite, which requires some additional description:



* These tests are running on all platforms because site isolation behavior may differ per platform

* All of the tests in the-iframe-element are being added because it would be useful to understand their behavior in all expected process

configurations

* The total time taken for this test suite on linux-rel showed a total time percentage of <0.3%



Bug: 41493458

entry.title: birch: Limit BirchModel data to the primary user under multi-profile
entry.content:
Multi-user-signin is a rarely used ChromeOS feature. For now, limit

BirchModel data to the primary (first) user in a session. Clear the

model on user switch and also when a secondary user requests a data

fetch. We'll also need some work at the UI layer on this, but that's

a separate task for when the UI is further along.

entry.title: Use base::HeapArray in ColorProfile
entry.content:
This change is being made as part of a code health rotation project

to convert all uses of std::unique_ptr with base::HeapArray.

std::unique_ptr does not automatically preserve the size of the

allocation. This forces a need for ad-hoc bounds checks. In contrast,

base::HeapArray does track the size. Please see the linked bug

for more information.



Important note: we still have to extract the raw pointer and size from

the HeapArray to pass directly third_party APIs like Skia.

Crossing the third-party boundary is not currently in scope but will be

addressed in the future.



Bug: 40285824,326459288

Change-Id: If82554237ce6a9d5aefab9723698a802b1cc29a8

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5350557

entry.title: [DSE] Fix an issue with enabling "EEA country only".
entry.content:
When the parameter "Enable EEA country only" is enabled, it checks

the shared preference whether "IS_EEA_CHOICE_COUNTRY" is set to be

true. However, if it is false, the check

#isNewTabSearchEngineUrlAndroidEnabled() returns false and DseNewTabUrlManager isn't created, and thus it won't set the

"IS_EEA_CHOICE_COUNTRY" in the sharedPreference. In this CL, we will

force to create the DseNewTabUrlManager as long as the feature flag

"NewTabSearchEngineUrlAndroid" is enabled.



Bug: 40279491

entry.title: pine: Resize the pine image to be smaller before encoding and saving it
entry.content:
Resize the pine image to be smaller before encoding and saving it.

As encoding and saving a smaller image will be faster, this will also

decrease the time needed to decode it later.

See the tests run with resizing the output to be 1/2 size of the

source size at https://docs.google.com/document/d/1XF4-trOMz3P2Ix5Fqb7fvOvQ2_HyTS5kIGnK9IcGyuY/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.ayr5wwcdm1b0

entry.title: Make Lightweight UAF Detector reports less confusing
entry.content:
At the moment, we report UAF crashes detected by LUD as

"lightweight-heap-use-after-free" and people are confused about what is

lightweight about them.



This change introduces a new field to the GWP-ASan proto that

represents the GWP-ASan mode and complements a similar backend change.
